newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LANDSBERGIS SAYS NATO SHOULD NOT DISCRIMINATE.
newsitem.headline: LANDSBERGIS SAYS NATO SHOULD NOT DISCRIMINATE.

text.p: The chairman of Lithuania's parliament and presidential candidate Vytautas Landsbergis said on Monday that his country wants to be invited to join NATO together with Poland.
"There are no arguments why a dividing line should be drawn for a few years between Lithuania and Poland," Landsbergis told a news conference.
Poland is expected to be invited to join NATO along with Hungary and the Czech Republic during a summit in Madrid in July.

Diplomats have all but written Lithuania and Baltic cousins Latvia and Estonia out of the first round of NATO expansion on the grounds that their inclusion would be regarded as a provocation by Moscow.
Landsbergis said that Lithuania was as qualified to join NATO as Poland and said that the West was having a difficult time explaining why Lithuania should be left out of the alliance.
"Evaluating the two countries according to the same criteria makes it difficult for Western politicians to answer why both countries will not be accepted together," Landsbergis said.
Landsbergis also said that the main aim of Lithuania is to be invited to join NATO with or without a particular date.
"We want it to be voiced that Lithuania will become a member of NATO," he said.
